page.title: 11The Post Office, Eglingham.
page.content: The Post Office was originally opened in the 1800's, the first in this area. The mail came into Eglingham and was sorted there, then delivered to nearby villages by three postmen on foot. Mr and Mrs Barclay took over the post office 25 years ago and in 1972 saw a big change. The mail became sorted and delivered from Alnwick. This postal area now covers only from New Bewick to Bannermoor and over to Beanly. Although the mail is not delivered from here now the post office is still very important because it covers a lot of other items:{ i.e.{pensions, allowances, licenses, { giro and savings bank, bus and rail { cards and travellers cheques. They also stock a good selection of groceries, stationery, papers, ice cream and ordered fresh bread, an essential in this rural community.
